summary: A character reference letter from Pandora Maxwell, the ex-wife of Ghislaine Maxwell's brother Kevin, to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application. The letter describes Ghislaine's character, family relationships, philanthropic work, and argues she is not a flight risk. Pandora Maxwell offers to pledge $33 million in assets as a bond.

persons.name: Pandora Maxwell
persons.context: Ex-wife of Kevin Maxwell (Ghislaine's brother), mother of seven children with Kevin, writes a letter to Judge Nathan supporting Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application and offering to pledge $33 million in assets as bond.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual for whom the bail application and character reference are written. Described by Pandora as vivacious, intelligent, dedicated to ocean conservation, and not a flight risk. She faces charges she vehemently denies.

persons.name: Kevin Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine's brother and the ex-husband of Pandora Maxwell, to whom she was married for 21 years and had seven children.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York to whom the character reference and bail support letter is addressed.

connections.description: Pandora is the ex-sister-in-law of Ghislaine, having been married to Ghislaine's brother Kevin for 21 years. She has known Ghislaine since 1979 and considers her a close family member.
Pandora is the ex-wife of Kevin Maxwell, to whom she was married for 21 years and with whom she has seven children.
Ghislaine and Kevin are siblings, part of a family of seven surviving siblings described as being close.
Pandora offers to pledge $33 million of her assets as a bond for Ghislaine's bail, stating financial ruin would result if Ghislaine violated release conditions.

events.title: Family Christmas hosted by Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell hosted a large family Christmas event, which also celebrated her birthday (Christmas Day). Pandora Maxwell and six of her children (plus grandchildren) attended, along with many Maxwell family members.

events.title: Family visit to Ghislaine's Manhattan home
events.description: Pandora Maxwell and her children visited Ghislaine Maxwell's home in Manhattan. Ghislaine was described as extremely busy with her philanthropic ocean conservation work at the time.

events.title: Submission of bail support letter
events.description: Pandora Maxwell writes and submits a character reference and bond pledge letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Pandora Maxwell, ex-wife of Ghislaine's brother Kevin, offers to pledge $33 million—effectively all her assets—as a bond for Ghislaine Maxwell's bail.
The letter asserts Ghislaine Maxwell is not in hiding from law enforcement and will appear in court as required to face charges she denies.
Ghislaine Maxwell is described as having a primary home in the US, with a London house used only for return visits to see family.
Pandora Maxwell has known Ghislaine since 1979 when Ghislaine was 18 and living at her family home in Oxford, UK.
Ghislaine Maxwell is portrayed as dedicated to ocean conservation philanthropy, including work with the UN and TED talks.
